metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: The CREATE UNIQUE INDEX command creates a unique index on a table (no duplicate values allowed)
content.html: The CREATE UNIQUE INDEX command creates a unique index on a table (no duplicate values allowed)

content.text: Indexes are used to retrieve data from the database very fast. The users cannot see the indexes, they are just used to speed up searches/queries.
content.html: Indexes are used to retrieve data from the database very fast. The users cannot see the indexes, they are just used to speed up searches/queries.

content.text: The following SQL creates an index named "uidx_pid" on the "PersonID" column in the "Persons" table:
content.html: The following SQL creates an index named "uidx_pid" on the "PersonID" column in the "Persons" table:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX uidx_pid
ON Persons (PersonID);

content.code:
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX uidx_pid
ON Persons (PersonID);

syntax_highlighting.text:
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX uidx_pid
ON Persons (PersonID);

content.code_html:
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX uidx_pid
ON Persons (PersonID);

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX uidx_pid
ON Persons (PersonID);

content.text: Note: The syntax for creating indexes varies among different databases. Therefore: Check the syntax for creating indexes in your database.
content.html: Note: The syntax for creating indexes varies among different databases. Therefore: Check the syntax for creating indexes in your database.

content.text: Note: Updating a table with indexes takes more time than updating a table without (because the indexes also need an update). So, only create indexes on columns that will be frequently searched against.
content.html: Note: Updating a table with indexes takes more time than updating a table without (because the indexes also need an update). So, only create indexes on columns that will be frequently searched against.
